title: Workshop on Elementary Computational Thinking Integrated Education Design: Scientific Inquiry and Algorithmic Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer science concepts, understanding of elementary educational environments, and foundational knowledge of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis formulation-experiment-observation-conclusion)
context.additional_context: A program for secondary learners to cultivate practical instructional design skills integrating computational thinking and scientific inquiry in primary education settings. Focuses on developing creative problem-solving cases linked to physical and life science phenomena and designing systematic evaluation tools. Especially emphasizes data analysis and scientific modeling using computational tools.

learning_goals: Develop one science-integrated computational thinking lesson plan using DBIR methodology (integrating experimental design, data analysis, variable control).
Create probability concept teaching materials using visual programming tools like Scratch (emphasizing simulation, measurement, scientific evidence collection).
Derive three or more learner computational thinking growth indicators (problem decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction ability assessment) based on project-based evaluation criteria.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
